    Infusions

    v06_infusions.Rmd

    There are 2 ways to implement infusions in pmxsim:

    • in the model: infusion duration or rate is defined for each compartment
    • in the dataset: infusion duration or rate is defined for infusion

    In the first case, the simulation engine will take care of the infusion duration or rate (RATE in dataset will be -1 or -2). In the second case, pmxsim will inject specific values in the RATE column of the dataset.

    Infusion duration or rate implemented in model

    Let’s use a 2-compartment model without absorption compartment to illustrate how this can be achieved.

    model <- model_library$advan3_trans4

    For this example, we’re going to define a lag time D1 for this absorption compartment.

    First let’s create a new parameter D1, log-normally distributed with a median of 5 hours and 20% CV.

    model <- model %>% add(Theta(name="D1", value=5))
model <- model %>% add(Omega(name="D1", value=20, type="cv%"))

    Now, let’s add an equation to the drug model to define D1.

    model <- model %>% addEquation("D1", rhs="THETA_D1*exp(ETA_D1)")

    Finally, we need to tell pmxsim that D1 corresponds the infusion duration for the first compartment.

    model <- model %>% add(InfusionDuration(compartment=1, rhs="D1"))

    Our persisted drug model would look like this:

    model
    ## [MAIN]
## CL=THETA_CL*exp(ETA_CL)
## V1=THETA_V1*exp(ETA_V1)
## V2=THETA_V2*exp(ETA_V2)
## Q=THETA_Q*exp(ETA_Q)
## S1=V1
## D1=THETA_D1*exp(ETA_D1)
## 
## [ODE]
## d/dt(A_CENTRAL)=Q*A_PERIPHERAL/V2 + (-CL/V1 - Q/V1)*A_CENTRAL
## d/dt(A_PERIPHERAL)=-Q*A_PERIPHERAL/V2 + Q*A_CENTRAL/V1
## d/dt(A_OUTPUT)=CL*A_CENTRAL/V1
## F=A_CENTRAL/S1
## 
## [DURATION]
## A_CENTRAL=D1
## 
## [ERROR]
## CP=F
## OBS_CP=CP*(EPS_PROP + 1)
## Y=OBS_CP
## 
## 
## THETA's:
##   name index value   fix
## 1   CL     1     5 FALSE
## 2   V1     2    80 FALSE
## 3   V2     3    20 FALSE
## 4    Q     4     4 FALSE
## 5   D1     5     5 FALSE
## OMEGA's:
##   name index index2  value   fix type same
## 1   CL     1      1  0.025 FALSE  var   NA
## 2   V1     2      2  0.025 FALSE  var   NA
## 3   V2     3      3  0.025 FALSE  var   NA
## 4    Q     4      4  0.025 FALSE  var   NA
## 5   D1     5      5 20.000 FALSE  cv%   NA
## SIGMA's:
##   name index index2 value   fix type
## 1 PROP     1      1 0.025 FALSE  var
## No variance-covariance matrix
## 
## Compartments:
## A_CENTRAL (CMT=1)
## A_PERIPHERAL (CMT=2)
## A_OUTPUT (CMT=3)

    Now, let’s infuse 1000 mg and run the simulation.

    ds1 <- Dataset(50)
ds1 <- ds1 %>% add(Infusion(time=0, amount=1000))
ds1 <- ds1 %>% add(Observations(times=seq(0,24,by=0.5)))
    results_d1 <- model %>% simulate(dataset=ds1, dest="RxODE", seed=1)
shadedPlot(results_d1, "CP")

    Infusion duration or rate inplemented in dataset

    The same simulation can be performed by defining the infusion duration in the dataset.

    For this, we need to sample D1 values. This can be done as follows:

    distribution <- ParameterDistribution(model=model, theta="D1", omega="D1")
d1Values <- (distribution %>% sample(as.integer(50)))@sampled_values

    Then, we can inject them into the dataset.

    ds2 <- Dataset(50)
ds2 <- ds2 %>% add(Infusion(time=0, amount=1000, duration=d1Values))
ds2 <- ds2 %>% add(Observations(times=seq(0,24,by=0.5)))

    Here is an overview of the dataset in its table form if we filter on the doses:

    ds2 %>% export(dest="RxODE") %>% dplyr::filter(EVID==1) %>% head()
    ##   ID ARM TIME EVID MDV  AMT CMT     RATE DOSENO
## 1  1   0    0    1   1 1000   1 174.0371      1
## 2  2   0    0    1   1 1000   1 121.7298      1
## 3  3   0    0    1   1 1000   1 290.7961      1
## 4  4   0    0    1   1 1000   1 224.7807      1
## 5  5   0    0    1   1 1000   1 280.8614      1
## 6  6   0    0    1   1 1000   1 217.3899      1

    Let’s now simulate this dataset using the original model.

    results_d1 <- model_library$advan4_trans4 %>% simulate(dataset=ds2, dest="RxODE", seed=1)
shadedPlot(results_d1, "CP")
